content:
I don't have personal experience or preference on this matter but i can give you a few tips on how to organize your closet efficiently.

1. start by decluttering: take everything out of your closet and sort through them. divide them into items that you wear regularly, items that you no longer wear, and items that need alteration or repair.
2. create piles: from the items you no longer wear, create two piles - one for donations and one for items you would like to sell.
3. categorize: organize your wardrobe by categories (pants, shirts, dresses, etc.) to make it easier to find items when you need them.
4. keep similar items together: within each category, group similar items together, such as all the pants in one section, all the shirts in another, and so on.
5. use organizers: use hangers, dividers, baskets, and shelves to keep everything in its place.
6. make it visually appealing: add labels or color-coding to make it easy to find items quickly.
7. review your clothing regularly: every season, review your clothes and donate or sell any items that you no longer use.

when it comes to what items to keep or donate/sell, ask yourself these questions:

1. have i worn it in the last year? 
2. does it still fit me well? 
3. does the item make me feel confident and comfortable? 
4. is it damaged, stained or torn in any way?

if the answer to the above questions is a yes for any item, then it's worth keeping. if it's a no, donate or sell it.
